intro: Dalechampia brownsbergensis, commonly known as the Brown's dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
